attributes.action: investigate the claims that the Cypriot government backed by Greece committed genocide against Turkish Cypriots starting mainly on the 20th of December 1963
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We Ask the British government to seriously investigate the incidents in Cyprus and setup a formal committee to give justice to the Turkish Cypriots for the Genocide committed against them.

Further Facts and Information: Under the Akritas Plan, the Greek Cypriots sought to annihilate the entire Turkish Cypriot population on Cyprus. Greek Cypriots started this campaign of annihilation of the Turkish Cypriot people on December 20, 1963. This atrocious night is known as Bloody Christmas. Bloody Christmas is to Turkish Cypriots what Kristallnacht is to the Jewish people.

rejection.details: The British Government believes that the intercommunal violence in Cyprus during the 1960s and 1970s should not be categorised as genocide as defined by the 1948 UN Convention on Genocide
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
